question: Which of the following is considered to have ushered India into era of License Raj?
explanation: The second five-year Plan and the Industrial Policy Resolution 1956 paved the way for the development of the public sector and India went into the licence Raj. The resolution was set out as a national objective. It categorized industries into three groups. Industries of basic and strategic importance to be exclusively in the public sector. The second group comprised industries that were to be incrementally state-owned. The third, comprising mostly consumer industries, was left for the private sector. The private sector, however, was kept on a system of licences.
